required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Oropharyngeal Administration of Colostrum to Extremely Low Gestational Age Newborns

brief_summary.textblock: Colostrum is rich in cytokines and other immune agents that may provide immunomodulatory protection against nosocomial infection in extremely premature infants. However, most of them could not proceed enteral feedings due to clinical instability in the first few days. Recent studies supports oropharyngeal administration as a potentially safe and effective delivery method for immunologic benefits and only small amount of colostrum could be administrated for immune therapy for extremely premature babies. The purpose of this study is to determine the beneficial effects of oropharyngeal administration of colostrum for immunologic aspects in extremely low gestational age infants and evaluated the safety of this method to extremely premature infants in the first few days of life.

primary_outcome.measure: Urinary Secretary IgA Concentration at 2 Weeks of Age

secondary_outcome.measure: Urinary Secretary IgA Concentration at 1 Week of Age
Salivary TGF-beta 1 Concentration at 2 Week of Age
Salivary IL-8 Concentration at 2 Weeks of Age
Concentration of Salivary Lactoferrin, Lysozyme, Alpha-lactalbumin and Cytokines
Concentration of Salivary Lactoferrin, Lysozyme, Alpha-lactalbumin and Cytokines

secondary_outcome.description: day of life when the baby reaches full enteral feeding, defined as a volume above 120~130mL/kg/day
days from admission to discharge from NICU

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from date of randomization up to 4 months of age
secondary_outcome.description: numbers of documented sepsis events defined as isolation of the microorganism from ≥ 1 blood culture + ≥ 1 clinical symptoms or sign (fever, hypothermia, apnea, bradycardia, hypo-/hyperglycemia)

secondary_outcome.measure: Episodes of Necrotizing Enterocolitis ≥ Bell's Stage 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from date of randomization up to 4 months of age
from date of randomization up to 4 months of age
secondary_outcome.description: numbers of documented pneumonia events those accompanied with increased tracheal secretion, increased ventilatory setting and treated with antibiotics

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the start date of oropharyngeal administration of colostrum or sterile water to 1 week of age
secondary_outcome.description: category of adverse effects general - fever or hypothermia, rash respiratory & cardiovascular - apnea, tachypnea, desaturation, hypotension, bradycardia, tachycardia gastrointestinal - abdominal distension, bilious gastric remain, vomiting, bloody stool, necrotizing enterocolitis renal - oliguria (urine output < 1.0cc/kg/day) laboratory - hypo-/hyper-natremia, acidosis, hypercarbia

arm_group.description: oropharyngeal administration of own mother's colostrum

intervention.intervention_name: oropharyngeal administration of own mother's colostrum
intervention.description: application of 0.2 mL of colostrum to the infant's oropharyngeal mucosa every 3 hours for 3 days from the postnatal 48 to 96 hours.
application of 0.2 mL of sterile water to the infant's oropharyngeal mucosa every 3 hours for 3 days from the postnatal 48 to 96 hours.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- premature infant with a gestational age less than 28 weeks born at Seoul National University Hospital and admit to the Seoul National University Children's Hospital NICU immediately after birth
- parents of the infant signed to the informed consent form with voluntary agreement
Exclusion Criteria:
- infants with major congenital anomalies or chromosomal syndromes
- infants of mothers not willing to provide colostrum in the first week of life
- infants of mothers with known infectious diseases that may be transmitted through the breast milk such as HIV, hepatitis C or active TB

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
